The calcium, estrogen, insulin, MAPK and PI3K-Akt-signaling pathways (Figs.Â 3, 4) are associated with gonadal development, ovarian steroidogenesis, oocyte maturation and steroid hormone biosynthesis

As a negative regulator of stress-activated MAP kinase (MAPK) signalling pathways, calcium pathway down-regulates inositol 1,4,5-trisphosphate receptor-dependent calcium signalling. It promotes cardiomyocyte hypertrophy via activation of the calcineurin/NFAT signalling pathway
